title: Wire atelier plan to planner skills
Add dry-run mode for atelier work
description:
scope: add dry-run mode to work command
changeset_strategy: code + tests

Notes
- Add a --dry-run flag to  that logs each step it would take, without mutating state or starting an agent.
- Output should include: selected epic, selected changeset, worktree paths, branch names, and the agent command that would be executed.
- Dry-run must show when it would message planner or exit.
- In watch mode, it should sleep and then log what it would do on each loop (without mutations).
- Should respect mode/queue/explicit epic handling and show the would-be outcomes.

Acceptance Criteria
-  logs the full sequence of actions and exits without side effects.
- Watch mode logs each idle loop without mutations.
- Tests cover selection + output behavior in dry-run mode.

title: External ticket model and provider contract
description:
Goal
Define the canonical local model for external ticket linkage and synchronization.

Scope
- Define provider contract for import, export, optional update, and optional state sync.
- Define canonical external_tickets shape stored on local beads.
- Define direction and source-of-truth semantics for linked fields.
- Define label conventions and provider capability flags.

Out of scope
- Provider-specific API implementation.

Notes
Local bead data should be a superset of remote ticket data.

title: Define external_tickets schema and validation
description:
Goal
Define a canonical external_tickets schema and implement validation helpers.

Scope
- Enumerate required/optional fields and allowed values.
- Define normalization rules for relation, direction, sync_mode, state.
- Add parsing/validation utilities and tests.

title: Define provider contract and capability matrix
description:
Goal
Specify the provider integration contract and capabilities.

Scope
- Define required provider operations (import/create/link/set_in_progress).
- Define optional operations (update/create_child/sync_state).
- Define capability flags and how planner consumes them.

title: Define planner sync interaction model
description:
Goal
Define how planner orchestrates external ticket sync.

Scope
- Startup import/sync option.
- On-demand import/export commands.
- Default behaviors for actionable vs context imports.

title: Define readiness and completeness rules
description:
Goal
Define readiness/completeness rules for external ticket integration.

Scope
- What constitutes "worker-ready" when external tickets exist.
- Required local fields and documentation completeness.
- Optional push-back rules when local is superset.

title: Add docs and examples for external ticket integration
description:
Goal
Add doc examples that reflect the canonical schema and workflow.

Scope
- Add schema examples and sample external_tickets entries.
- Add example planner import/export flows.
- Clarify relation/direction/state usage in prose.

title: Define skill integration contract for external tickets
description:
Goal
Specify how skills interact with external ticket schemas and provider contracts.

Scope
- Define skill input payloads (provider name, bead id, sync mode, filters).
- Define skill output payloads (normalized external ticket records).
- Define mapping rules from skill outputs into external_tickets entries.
- Define failure/partial-sync handling expectations.

title: Optional enrichment and minimal lifecycle sync
description:
Goal
Add optional refinement sync paths without making remote systems authoritative.

Scope
- Optional import/export of notes and extended body details.
- Optional remote state update for in_progress and selected additional states.
- Clear per-provider toggles for what is synced and in which direction.
- Conflict handling strategy that preserves local planning completeness.

Out of scope
- Mandatory full bidirectional lifecycle mirroring.

Notes
The default should remain conservative and prioritize reliable local planning context.
close_reason: Completed enrichment fields, sync toggles, and documentation.

title: Define changeset lifecycle state machine
description:
scope: status/label model + transitions
changeset_strategy: 2 changesets (model + workflow)

Questions:
- Which statuses/labels are canonical?
- How should non-review projects map states?
notes:
Decision: propose lifecycle labels for review vs non-review and determine ad-hoc vs molecules.
Decisions: use cs: labels; PR-derived states computed (pushed/draft-pr/in-review/approved/merged). in-review only when a non-bot reviewer is assigned. No separate changes-requested state. Use cs:merged for integrated/merged across review and non-review; cs:abandoned for closed without merge. Use dependencies instead of cs:blocked.

title: Define lifecycle statuses and labels
description:
scope: model + docs
changeset_strategy: code + docs
notes:
Decisions:
- Use cs: labels for intent: cs:planned, cs:ready, cs:in_progress, cs:merged, cs:abandoned.
- PR-derived states are computed (pushed/draft-pr/in-review/approved/merged); do not persist as labels.
- in-review only when non-bot reviewer assigned.
- Dependencies represent blocked work (no cs:blocked).

title: Wire lifecycle transitions into work/publish
description:
scope: work/publish flows
changeset_strategy: code + tests
notes: Decisions:\n- Work/publish should compute PR lifecycle from Git/PR state and update cs:merged on integration; cs:abandoned on closed without merge.\n- Do not write PR-derived labels.

title: GitHub Issues built-in provider
description:
Goal
Ship first-party GitHub Issues support in Atelier core.

Scope
- Import existing GitHub issues and map them to local beads (usually epics).
- Export local planned beads to GitHub issues and persist association metadata.
- Support setting remote issue state to in_progress.
- Keep provider-specific data needed for reliable round trips.

Out of scope
- Full lifecycle mirroring beyond in_progress by default.

Notes
GitHub provider should work out of the box with no custom skill installation.

title: Repository Beads external provider
description:
Goal
Treat source repository Beads as an external provider rather than Atelier planning storage.

Scope
- Define provider adapter for repo-local Beads import/export linkage.
- Map repo Beads issue fields to canonical external_tickets linkage.
- Ensure Atelier planning uses only project-scoped Beads store.
- Prevent accidental mutation of repo-local Beads unless explicitly exporting.

Out of scope
- Cross-repo federation behavior.

Notes
This allows repositories that already use Beads to integrate without merging stores.
